alert.note: Alert for Duchesne; Wasatch (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 3:46PM MDT until August 01 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL DUCHESNE AND SOUTHEASTERN WASATCH COUNTIES... At 346 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. A USGS gauge on the Strawberry River at Pinnacles has already seen an increase in streamflow to 400 cfs. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Promised Land Resort in the Pinnacles area. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
